definition.title: AWS DynamoDB Streams Source
definition.description: Receive events from AWS DynamoDB Streams.

table.title: Table
table.description: Name of the DynamoDB table to look at

accessKey.title: Access Key
accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS

secretKey.title: Secret Key
secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS

region.title: AWS Region
region.description: The AWS region to connect to

iteratorType.title: Iterator Type
iteratorType.description: Defines where in the DynaboDB stream to start getting records. Note that using TRIM_HORIZON can cause a significant delay before the stream has caught up to real-time. if {AT,AFTER}_SEQUENCE_NUMBER are used, then a sequenceNumberProvider MUST be supplied. There are 4 enums and the value can be one of TRIM_HORIZON, LATEST, AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER, AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

sequenceNumberProvider.title: Sequence Number Provider
sequenceNumberProvider.description: Provider for the sequence number when using one of the two ShardIteratorType AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER iterator types. Can be a registry reference or a literal sequence number.

definition.title: AWS Kinesis Sink
definition.description:
Send data to AWS Kinesis.

The Kamelet expects the following header:

- `partition` / `ce-partition`: to set the Kinesis partition key

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used.

The Kamelet is also able to recognize the following header:

- `sequence-number` / `ce-sequence-number`: to set the Sequence number

This header is optional.

stream.title: Stream Name
stream.description: The Kinesis stream that you want to access (needs to be created in advance)

accessKey.title: Access Key
accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS

secretKey.title: Secret Key
secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS

region.title: AWS Region
region.description: The AWS region to connect to (capitalized name)

definition.title: Azure Eventhubs Sink
definition.description:
Send Events to Azure Eventhubs.

The Kamelet is able to understand the following headers to be set:

- `partition` / `ce-partition`: as the time to live of the message in the queue.

If the header won't be set then the partition will be assigned by Eventhubs

sharedAccessKey.description: The key for EventHubs SAS key name

definition.description:
Upload data to Azure Storage Blob.

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `file` / `ce-file`: as the file name to upload

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as file name.

definition.title: Azure Storage Queue Sink
definition.description:
Send Messages to Azure Storage queues.

The Kamelet is able to understand the following headers to be set:

- `expiration` / `ce-expiration`: as the time to live of the message in the queue.

If the header won't be set the default of 7 days will be used.

The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S — parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D — parses as 2 days.

accountName.title: Account Name
accountName.description: The Azure Storage Queue account name.

queueName.title: Queue Name
queueName.description: The Azure Storage Queue container name.

accessKey.title: Access Key
accessKey.description: The Azure Storage Queue access Key.

definition.title: Bitcoin Source
definition.description: Provides a feed of the value of the Bitcoin compared to USDT using the Binance service.

period.title: Period between Updates
period.description: The interval between updates in milliseconds

definition.title: Caffeine Action
definition.description:
Perform operations on a caffeine cache

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `caffeine-key` / `ce-caffeine-key`: as the cache key used in the operation

- `caffeine-operation` / `ce-caffeine-operation`: as the operation to perform. It can be PUT, GET, INVALIDATE and CLEANUP.

If the caffeine-key header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as key.

If the caffeine-operation header won't be set, the GET operation will be performed.

cacheName.title: Cache name
cacheName.description: The name of the cache we want to use

definition.title: Cassandra Sink
definition.description:
Send data to a Cassandra Cluster.

This Kamelet expects the body as JSON Array. The content of the JSON Array will be used as input for the CQL Prepared Statement set in the query parameter.

host.title: Host
host.description: Hostname(s) cassandra server(s). Multiple hosts can be separated by comma.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to use for accessing a secured Cassandra Cluster

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to use for accessing a secured Cassandra Cluster

consistencyLevel.title: Consistency Level
consistencyLevel.description: Consistency level to use. The value can be one of ANY, ONE, TWO, THREE, QUORUM, ALL, LOCAL_QUORUM, EACH_QUORUM, SERIAL, LOCAL_SERIAL, LOCAL_ONE

preparedStatement.title: Prepared Statement
preparedStatement.description: The Prepared statement to execute against the Cassandra cluster table

definition.title: Cassandra Source
definition.description: Query a Cassandra cluster table.

host.title: Host
host.description: Hostname(s) cassandra server(s). Multiple hosts can be separated by comma.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to use for accessing a secured Cassandra Cluster

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to use for accessing a secured Cassandra Cluster

resultStrategy.title: Result Strategy
resultStrategy.description: The strategy to convert the result set of the query. Possible values are ALL, ONE, LIMIT_10, LIMIT_100...

consistencyLevel.title: Consistency Level
consistencyLevel.description: Consistency level to use. The value can be one of ANY, ONE, TWO, THREE, QUORUM, ALL, LOCAL_QUORUM, EACH_QUORUM, SERIAL, LOCAL_SERIAL, LOCAL_ONE

query.title: Query
query.description: The query to execute against the Cassandra cluster table

definition.title: Cron Source
definition.description: Send events at specific time.

schedule.title: Cron Schedule
schedule.description: A cron expression that will be used to trigger events generation.

definition.title: DNS DIG Action
definition.description:
Query a DNS through Dig

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `domain-name` / `ce-domain-name`: as the domain for which we are querying the DNS

- `dns-type` / `ce-dns-type`: as the DNS type

If the domain-name header won't be set the body will be used as domain name.

If the dns-type header won't be set, the DNS Type A will be used.

definition.title: DNS IP Action
definition.description:
Get an IP from a DNS

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `domain` / `ce-domain`: as the domain for which we are looking for the IP

If the header won't be set the body will be used as domain to look for.

definition.title: DNS Lookup Action
definition.description:
Lookup for a domain

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `domain-name` / `ce-domain-name`: as the domain for which we are looking up

If the domain-name header won't be set the body will be used as domain name.

definition.title: Dropbox Sink
definition.description:
Upload Files to Dropbox.

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `file` / `ce-file`: as the file name to upload

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as file name.

accessToken.title: Dropbox Access Token
accessToken.description: The access Token to use to access Dropbox

remotePath.title: Remote Path
remotePath.description: Original file or folder to work with

uploadMode.title: Upload Mode
uploadMode.description: Which mode to upload. in case of add the new file will be renamed if a file with the same name already exists on dropbox. in case of force if a file with the same name already exists on dropbox, this will be overwritten. The value can be one of add, force.

definition.title: Dropbox Source
definition.description: Consume Files from Dropbox.

period.title: Period between Polls
period.description: The interval between fetches to the Dropbox remote path in milliseconds

accessToken.title: Dropbox Access Token
accessToken.description: The access Token to use to access Dropbox

remotePath.title: Remote Path
remotePath.description: Original file or folder to work with

query.title: Queries
query.description: A space-separated list of sub-strings to search for. A file matches only if it contains all the sub-strings. If this option is not set, all files will be matched.

definition.title: Earthquake Source
definition.description: Get data about current earthquake events happening in the world using the USGS API

period.title: Period between Polls
period.description: The interval between fetches to the earthquake API in milliseconds

lookAhead.title: Look-ahead Minutes
lookAhead.description: The amount of minutes to look ahead when starting the integration afresh

sources.name: ESWorkaround.java

definition.title: ElasticSearch Index Sink
definition.description:
This sink stores documents into ElasticSearch.

Input data must have JSON format according to the index used.

If the *indexId* parameter is set, that value will be used as the document ID on ElasticSearch.

If the *indexId* parameter is not set and the source of the kamelet binding is a Kafka broker, it will take the kafka topic, partition and offset of the
element to generate an automatic ID that warrantees that this element is processed only once.

If the *indexName* parameter is not set and the source of the kamelet binding is a Kafka broker, it will take the kafka topic as the indexName.

enableSSL.title: Enable SSL
enableSSL.description: Do we want to connect using SSL?

hostAddresses.title: Host Addresses
hostAddresses.description: Comma separated list with ip:port formatted remote transport addresses to use.

indexName.title: Index in ElasticSearch
indexName.description: The name of the index to act against.

accessToken.description: OAuth 2 access token for google calendar application. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

refreshToken.description: OAuth 2 refresh token for google calendar application. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

definition.title: Kafka Not Secured Sink
definition.description:
Send data to Kafka topics on an insecure broker.

The Kamelet is able to understand the following headers to be set:

- `key` / `ce-key`: as message key

- `partition-key` / `ce-partition-key`: as message partition key

Both the headers are optional.

topic.title: Topic Names
topic.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names

brokers.title: Brokers
brokers.description: Comma separated list of Kafka Broker URLs

definition.title: Kafka Not Secured Source
definition.description: Receive data from Kafka topics on an insecure broker.

topic.title: Topic Names
topic.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names

brokers.title: Brokers
brokers.description: Comma separated list of Kafka Broker URLs

autoCommitEnable.title: Auto Commit Enable
autoCommitEnable.description: If true, periodically commit to ZooKeeper the offset of messages already fetched by the consumer

allowManualCommit.title: Allow Manual Commit
allowManualCommit.description: Whether to allow doing manual commits

pollOnError.title: Poll On Error Behavior
pollOnError.description: What to do if kafka threw an exception while polling for new messages. There are 5 enums and the value can be one of DISCARD, ERROR_HANDLER, RECONNECT, RETRY, STOP

autoOffsetReset.title: Auto Offset Reset
autoOffsetReset.description: What to do when there is no initial offset. There are 3 enums and the value can be one of latest, earliest, none

definition.title: Kafka Sink
definition.description:
Send data to Kafka topics.

The Kamelet is able to understand the following headers to be set:

- `key` / `ce-key`: as message key

- `partition-key` / `ce-partition-key`: as message partition key

Both the headers are optional.

topic.title: Topic Names
topic.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names

brokers.title: Brokers
brokers.description: Comma separated list of Kafka Broker URLs

securityProtocol.title: Security Protocol
securityProtocol.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. SASL_PLAINTEXT, PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL and SSL are supported

saslMechanism.title: SASL Mechanism
saslMechanism.description: The Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism used.

saslMechanism.title: SASL Mechanism
saslMechanism.description: The Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism used.

autoCommitEnable.title: Auto Commit Enable
autoCommitEnable.description: If true, periodically commit to ZooKeeper the offset of messages already fetched by the consumer

allowManualCommit.title: Allow Manual Commit
allowManualCommit.description: Whether to allow doing manual commits

pollOnError.title: Poll On Error Behavior
pollOnError.description: What to do if kafka threw an exception while polling for new messages. There are 5 enums and the value can be one of DISCARD, ERROR_HANDLER, RECONNECT, RETRY, STOP

autoOffsetReset.title: Auto Offset Reset
autoOffsetReset.description: What to do when there is no initial offset. There are 3 enums and the value can be one of latest, earliest, none

definition.title: Mail IMAP Source
definition.description: Receive unread emails from an IMAP mail server, marking them as read once they are received.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to access the mail box

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to access the mail box

fetchSize.title: Fetch Size
fetchSize.description: The number of messages fetched for each poll (-1 for no limits)

delay.title: Delay
delay.description: The delay between fetches in milliseconds

definition.title: Mask Fields Action
definition.description: Mask fields with a constant value in the message in transit

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Comma separated list of fields to mask

replacement.title: Replacement
replacement.description: Replacement for the fields to be masked

definition.title: Message Timestamp Router Action
definition.description: Update the topic field as a function of the original topic name and the record's timestamp field.

topicFormat.title: Topic Format
topicFormat.description: Format string which can contain '$[topic]' and '$[timestamp]' as placeholders for the topic and timestamp, respectively.

timestampFormat.title: Timestamp Format
timestampFormat.description: Format string for the timestamp that is compatible with java.text.SimpleDateFormat.

timestampKeys.title: Timestamp Keys
timestampKeys.description: Comma separated list of Timestamp keys. The timestamp is taken from the first found field.

timestampKeyFormat.title: Timestamp Keys Format
timestampKeyFormat.description: Format of the timestamp keys. Possible values are 'timestamp' or any format string for the timestamp that is compatible with java.text.SimpleDateFormat. In case of 'timestamp' the field will be evaluated as milliseconds since 1970, so as a UNIX Timestamp.

definition.title: Minio Sink
definition.description:
Upload data to Minio.

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `file` / `ce-file`: as the file name to upload

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as file name.

accessKey.title: Access Key
accessKey.description: The access key obtained from Minio

secretKey.title: Secret Key
secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from Minio

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: The Minio Endpoint, it can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

autoCreateBucket.title: Autocreate Bucket
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName.

definition.title: Minio Source
definition.description: Receive data from Minio.

accessKey.title: Access Key
accessKey.description: The access key obtained from Minio

secretKey.title: Secret Key
secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from Minio

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: The Minio Endpoint, it can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

autoCreateBucket.title: Autocreate Bucket
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName.

definition.title: MQTT Source
definition.description: Allows receiving messages from any endpoint that supports the MQTT protocol, such as a message broker.

brokerUrl.title: Broker URL
brokerUrl.description: The URL of the broker where to establish the connection

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description: The client ID to use when connecting to the resource

definition.title: NATS Source
definition.description: Receive data from NATS topics.

servers.title: Servers
servers.description: Comma separated list of NATS Servers

definition.title: OpenAI Classification Action
definition.description:
Classifies a sentence using the OpenAI API.

It requires an OpenAI account (beta accounts available at https://beta.openai.com/).

Training data for classification can be provided in advance by uploading a file with purpose="classifications", see: https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files/upload.

The Kamelet accepts data in:

- `text/plain` format (default)
- `application/json` format: see reference at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/classifications/create

authorizationToken.title: Authorization Token
authorizationToken.description: The authorization token to use to contact the openAI API

format.title: Format
format.description: The response format ('text/plain' or 'application/json' are supported)

file.title: Examples File
file.description: The ID of an uploaded file containing examples for classification

definition.title: OpenAI Completion Action
definition.description:
Completes a sentence using the OpenAI API.

It requires an OpenAI account (beta accounts available at https://beta.openai.com/).

The Kamelet accepts data in:

- `text/plain` format (default)
- `application/json` format: see reference at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/create

authorizationToken.title: Authorization Token
authorizationToken.description: The authorization token to use to contact the openAI API

format.title: Format
format.description: The response format ('text/plain' or 'application/json' are supported)

definition.title: PDF Action
definition.description: Create a PDF

font.title: Font
font.description: The font to use while generating the PDF. One of Courier, Courier-Bold, Courier-Oblique, Courier-BoldOblique, Helvetica, Helvetica-Bold, Helvetica-Oblique, Helvetica-BoldOblique, Times-Roman, Times-Bold, Times-Italic, Times-BoldItalic, Symbol, ZapfDingbats

fontSize.title: Font Size
fontSize.description: The Font size to use while generating the PDF

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The Page size to use while generating the PDF. One of LETTER, LEGAL, A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6

definition.title: RabbitMQ Source
definition.description: Receive data from an RabbitMQ Brokers.

addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: Comma separated list of RabbitMQ broker addresses

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to access the RabbitMQ server

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to access the RabbitMQ server

exchangeName.title: Exchange name
exchangeName.description: The exchange name determines the exchange the queue will be bound to

definition.title: Regex Router Action
definition.description: Update the destination using the configured regular expression and replacement string

definition.title: Replace Field Action
definition.description: Replace field with a different key in the message in transit

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Comma separated list of fields to be enabled

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Comma separated list of fields to be disabled

renames.title: Renames
renames.description: Comma separated list of field with new value to be renamed

definition.title: Salesforce Source
definition.description: Receive updates from Salesforce.

query.title: Query
query.description: The query to execute on Salesforce
query.example: SELECT Id, Name, Email, Phone FROM Contact

topicName.title: Topic Name
topicName.description: The name of the topic/channel to use

definition.title: SFTP Source
definition.description: Receive data from an SFTP Server.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to access the SFTP server

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to access the SFTP server

recursive.title: Recursive
recursive.description: If a directory, will look for files in all the sub-directories as well.

definition.title: Slack Source
definition.description: Receive messages from a Slack channel.

channel.title: Channel
channel.description: The Slack channel to receive messages from

token.title: Token
token.description: The token to access Slack. A Slack app is needed. This app needs to have channels:history and channels:read permissions. The Bot User OAuth Access Token is the kind of token needed.

definition.title: SSH Source
definition.description: Receive data from SSH session.

pollCommand.title: Poll Command
pollCommand.description: The command to run while polling the SSH session

definition.title: Telegram Sink
definition.description:
Send a message to a Telegram chat using your Telegram bot as sender.

To create a bot, contact the @botfather account using the Telegram app.

This sink supports the following message types:

- Standard text messages
- PNG images (`Content-Type` must be set to `image/png`)
- JPEG images (`Content-Type` must be set to `image/jpeg`)

This following message headers are also supported:

- `text` / `ce-text`: when sending an image, the image caption
- `chat-id` / `ce-chat-id`: to override the default chat where messages are sent to

authorizationToken.title: Token
authorizationToken.description: The token to access your bot on Telegram. You you can obtain it from the Telegram @botfather.

chatId.title: Chat ID
chatId.description: The Chat ID where messages should be sent by default

definition.title: Telegram Source
definition.description:
Receive all messages that people send to your Telegram bot.

To create a bot, contact the @botfather account using the Telegram app.

authorizationToken.title: Token
authorizationToken.description: The token to access your bot on Telegram. You you can obtain it from the Telegram @botfather.

definition.title: Timer Source
definition.description: Produces periodic events with a custom payload.

period.title: Period
period.description: The interval between two events in milliseconds

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The content type of the message being generated

definition.title: Timestamp Router Action
definition.description: Update the topic field as a function of the original topic name and the record timestamp.

topicFormat.title: Topic Format
topicFormat.description: Format string which can contain '$[topic]' and '$[timestamp]' as placeholders for the topic and timestamp, respectively.

timestampFormat.title: Timestamp Format
timestampFormat.description: Format string for the timestamp that is compatible with java.text.SimpleDateFormat.

timestampHeaderName.title: Timestamp Header Name
timestampHeaderName.description: The name of the header containing a timestamp

definition.title: Twitter Direct Message Source
definition.description:
Allows to get all direct messages for your Twitter account.

It requires tokens that can be obtained by creating an application 
in the Twitter developer portal: https://developer.twitter.com/.

user.title: User
user.description: The user we want to read the direct messages

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.description: The API Key from the Twitter application in the developer portal

apiKeySecret.title: API Key Secret
apiKeySecret.description: The API Key Secret from the Twitter application in the developer portal

accessToken.title: Access Token
accessToken.description: The Access Token from the Twitter application in the developer portal

accessTokenSecret.title: Access Token Secret
accessTokenSecret.description: The Access Token Secret from the Twitter application in the developer portal

definition.title: Twitter Search Source
definition.description:
Allows to get all tweets on particular keywords from Twitter.

It requires tokens that can be obtained by creating an application 
in the Twitter developer portal: https://developer.twitter.com/.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: The keywords to use in the Twitter search (Supports Twitter standard operators)

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.description: The API Key from the Twitter application in the developer portal

apiKeySecret.title: API Key Secret
apiKeySecret.description: The API Key Secret from the Twitter application in the developer portal

accessToken.title: Access Token
accessToken.description: The Access Token from the Twitter application in the developer portal

accessTokenSecret.title: Access Token Secret
accessTokenSecret.description: The Access Token Secret from the Twitter application in the developer portal

definition.title: Twitter Timeline Source
definition.description:
Allows to get tweets from the timeline of a specific user from Twitter.

It requires tokens that can be obtained by creating an application 
in the Twitter developer portal: https://developer.twitter.com/.

user.title: User
user.description: The user we want to read the timeline

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.description: The API Key from the Twitter application in the developer portal

apiKeySecret.title: API Key Secret
apiKeySecret.description: The API Key Secret from the Twitter application in the developer portal

accessToken.title: Access Token
accessToken.description: The Access Token from the Twitter application in the developer portal

accessTokenSecret.title: Access Token Secret
accessTokenSecret.description: The Access Token Secret from the Twitter application in the developer portal

definition.title: Value to Key Action
definition.description: Replace the Kafka record key with a new key formed from a subset of fields in the body

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Comma separated list of fields to be used to form the new key

definition.title: Webhook Source
definition.description:
Creates an HTTP endpoint that can be used as a bridge to forward data to the Kamelet sink.

The "subpath" parameter of the Webhook source allows to customize the subpath where the integration will respond to HTTP requests.
It's common to use a non-guessable ID for that parameter.

When the "subpath" parameter is set to "webhook" (default), the integration will accept requests at the "https://integration-external-url/webhook" endpoint.

subpath.title: Subpath
subpath.description: The subpath where the webhook is registered
